steps.title: Some research suggests that Bio-Oil can reduce stretch marks and scars.
steps.content: Some research suggests that Bio-Oil can reduce stretch marks and scars. In one particular study, participants treated their stretch marks or scars with Bio-Oil over an 8-week period. At the end of the trial, over half of the participants agreed that the product reduced their blemishes. [1] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Reap these benefits yourself by rubbing Bio-Oil directly on your scars and stretch marks twice a day for at least 3 months. Bio-Oil is formulated to treat a variety of scars, including ones from surgical operations. The company officially claims that Bio-Oil can help with acne scars, too. Just keep your skin type in mind before you use this product—it might not be the best option for people with oily or acne-prone skin. [2] X Research source Use Bio-Oil during your entire pregnancy (including the first trimester) to help prevent stretch marks. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Certain research shows that Bio-Oil can help even out your pigmentation.
steps.content: Certain research shows that Bio-Oil can help even out your pigmentation. In one small study, people with uneven pigmentation rubbed Bio-Oil around their face and neck 2 times a day for a total of 12 weeks. At the end of the study, the vast majority of participants felt that their skin looked better and more evenly pigmented after the Bio-Oil treatments. Apply the product to any uneven pigmentation on your own face or neck—the official company recommends rubbing it in a circular motion directly onto your skin. For the best results, apply Bio-Oil twice a day for at least 3 months.

steps.title: Bio-Oil is a very effective moisturizer.
steps.content: Bio-Oil is a very effective moisturizer. Research shows that Bio-Oil is great at locking moisture into your skin. In fact, one particular study puts Bio-Oil’s moisturizing capabilities on par with vernix caseosa, the filmy material that covers babies that are still in the womb. Apply Bio-Oil to any part of your skin that could use a little extra moisture, rubbing the product in circular motions as you go. Bio-Oil moisturizing qualities can help reduce wrinkles and lines, making it a great product for aging skin. [4] X Research source Use it to moisturize your lips, too! Switch out your normal lip balm with a drop or 2 of Bio-Oil. Some Bio-Oil users recommend mixing a few drops of the product with your usual body lotion or cream.

steps.title: Bio-Oil nourishes your skin without leaving it greasy.
steps.content: Bio-Oil nourishes your skin without leaving it greasy. The formula is non-comedogenic; in other words, it won’t clog up your pores or lead to acne breakouts. Feel free to apply this oil to your skin twice a day—once in the morning and once in the evening is a good schedule to follow. [5] X Research source Bio-Oil is full of vitamin A, which helps boost your skin’s elasticity and texture. It also includes vitamin E, which helps moisturize and protect your skin. That’s a pretty great combo for a face oil!

steps.title: Bio-Oil is an effective moisturizer that’s great for your cuticles.
steps.content: Bio-Oil is an effective moisturizer that’s great for your cuticles. Squeeze a small drop onto each finger and rub it in gently but thoroughly with one of the fingers on your other hand. Goodbye, dried-out cuticles!

steps.title: Bio-Oil gives your bath a moisturizing and great-smelling boost.
steps.content: Bio-Oil gives your bath a moisturizing and great-smelling boost. It’s made with rosemary and lavender oil, giving your bath a relaxing and invigorating touch. Just stir a few drops in with the rest of your bath water to enjoy a luxurious soak. [6] X Research source Bio-Oil is also made with chamomile oil, which adds a calming touch to your bath.

steps.title: Body oils are a great alternative to traditional shaving cream.
steps.content: Body oils are a great alternative to traditional shaving cream. [7] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Just massage a few drops of Bio-Oil onto your skin before you start shaving so the razor moves smoothly. Make sure that your skin feels really lubricated, and rub a few extra drops into your skin if needed.

steps.title: Bio-Oil removes makeup while hydrating your skin.
steps.content: Bio-Oil removes makeup while hydrating your skin. It sticks to the oil in your makeup, making it super easy to remove. Just squeeze a few drops onto a cotton ball or pad and start dabbing at your makeup—it’ll come right off. [8] X Research source Some Bio-Oil enthusiasts also use it to clean their cosmetic brushes.

steps.title: Bio-Oil gives your bronzer an extra glow.
steps.content: Bio-Oil gives your bronzer an extra glow. Squeeze 1-2 drops into your favorite bronzer and apply it as you normally would . Your skin now looks a little brighter and more invigorated! [9] X Research source This hack works with both liquid and powder bronzers.

steps.title: Bio-Oil can help your spray tan from washing off in the shower.
steps.content: Bio-Oil can help your spray tan from washing off in the shower. Massage a little bit of Bio-Oil into all of your spray-tanned skin right before you hop in the shower. The oil protects the tanning product in the shower so it isn’t as likely to run off. Bio-Oil can help with sunless tanning products, too. While you’re self-tanning, rub a few drops of Bio-Oil around your knees and elbows to keep the tanning product from streaking.

steps.title: Bio-Oil’s anti-inflammatory ingredients help calm irritated skin.
steps.content: Bio-Oil’s anti-inflammatory ingredients help calm irritated skin. After a round of eyebrow plucking, your skin might be looking a bit red, swollen, and worse for wear. Not to worry, though—a quick dab of Bio-Oil over the trouble spots can help ease away any redness and discomfort. [10] X Research source Bio-Oil is made with chamomile and calendula oil, which are both great for easing inflammation.

steps.title: Bio-Oil is totally safe to apply as a topical essential oil.
steps.content: Bio-Oil is totally safe to apply as a topical essential oil. Lavender and rosemary oil are both key ingredients in Bio-Oil’s formula, as well as popular essential oils. Rub this powerful oil combo directly onto your skin—for the best effects, massage therapists suggest focusing on your wrists, arms, and top of your feet. [11] X Research source Feel free to massage the oil around your neck and the back of your ears, too. Lavender oil helps promote relaxation, while rosemary oil can help with pain and boost your mood. [12] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Bio-Oil is also an effective massage oil.

steps.title: Apply a few drops of Bio-Oil as an overnight treatment.
steps.content: Apply a few drops of Bio-Oil as an overnight treatment. Massage a drop or 2 into your scalp if it’s feeling a bit itchy or uncomfortable. Then, wrap a hair scarf around your locks before heading to bed. In the morning, your scalp may feel a little bit better. [13] X Research source You can also rub a little bit of oil along the ends of your hair. Just remember—a little goes a long way! Some people find that Bio-Oil is an effective tamer for stubborn strands of hair, too.

steps.title: Bio-Oil has helped some people with their peeling, sunburnt skin.
steps.content: Bio-Oil has helped some people with their peeling, sunburnt skin. Calendula oil is a key ingredient in Bio-Oil, which is a natural remedy for irritated, sensitive, and/or sunburned skin. Massage a few drops over the burned skin to keep it from peeling. With all of its anti-inflammatory ingredients, Bio-Oil can help soothe your sunburn, too.
